column4: I have a computer guy here trying to fix my wireless problem, any suggestions?
if you've got a tech there, why ask us?  (sorry about attitude, i don't mean anything by it)
Hes not a linux guy
explain your wireless issues to me here, and tell the Windows guy to stop recommending windows because you want to use *nix
My wife decides, and she doesnt care either way
regardless, details about your wireless issues, please
Iwconfig shows the adapter as working, mabye the drivers are imperfect?
not enough details, more please, like what's the exact issues you have now?
The GUI shows the network, but a WEP connection fails
wicd or network manager?
Network manager
interesting, haven't had that happen before, you tried rebooting the router to see if its a router-side issue?
reboot as in unplug the router/modem for a minute, plug it back in
Ive tried for months
what wifi card?
I have to go right now, but perhaps blue-frog can help you out
WUSB600N
is it possible your router is denying Linux connections?
Why?
some routers and things dont like nix
Would linksys do that on purpose?
not sure, might be a glitch in the hardware's files, but i'm not super-familiar with Linksys
